name: Polyreduce SOP
description: The Polyreduce SOP reduces a high detail polygonal model into one consisting of fewer polygons. The second input's polygons represent feature edges. They are matched to the input mesh by point numbers.
summary: The Polyreduce SOP reduces a high detail polygonal model into one consisting of fewer polygons. The second input's polygons represent feature edges. They are matched to the input mesh by point numbers

parameters.name: Polygons
parameters.label: Polygons
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Polyreduce  reduces a high detail polygonal model into one consisting of fewer polygons. The second input's polygons represent feature edges. They are matched to the input mesh by point numbers.	
The methods to reduce polygonal models are:		

A percentage of their former size
A specfic number of polys (within a few)
According to distance from a cameraNote that as it requires (and outputs) a triangular mesh, the polygon count may increase as a result of this operation.		
A second input for feature edges is provided.
polyreduceSOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  reduce - The polygons which will be candidates for simplification. Other polygons which share points with these might also be affected.



  creases - Which polygons are feature edges.



  method -  - Select how to reduce the number of polygons from the following methods.

 percentage - Choose reduction level with a percentage. number - Choose reduction level by number of polygons. distance - Reduce polygons based on distance to an object.

  percentage - Specify the percentage of polygons to keep when Method set to 'Percentage'.



  numpolys - Specify the number of polygons to keep when Method set to 'Number'.



  obj - The object to use as a reference.



  distance - The world distance at which the polygons should be left at full detail.



  minpercent - A lower bound to the level of reduction.





  borderweight - Without any constraints, the edges of planar surfaces can erode. This controls a bias which penalizes such erosion.



  creaseweight - The amount of penalty to add to the feature edges being eroded.



  lengthweight - This bias penalizes the removal of long edges. It tends to reduce high aspect ratio triangles at the expense of more uniform reduction.



  meshinvert - When enabled, each reduction is tested to see if it would flip a triangle normal. While encurring a slight cost, the results are almost always worth it.



  triangulate - As only triangular polygons will be reduced, this option will automatically triangulate the input polygons.



  keepedges - This prohibits the removal of any edge that occurs at the boundary of the polygons. This ensures no cracks develop with unreduced areas.



  originalpoints - When it collapses edges, it will use one of the two original points instead of finding the optimal interior point.





 -
 -


Extra Information for the Polyreduce  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of points in this . - Number of primitives in this . - Number of particles in this . - Time spent in another thread updating geometry data on the  from the 's CPU data. As it is part of another thread, this time is not part of the usual frame time. - Time spent in another thread updating meta surface geometry data (such as metaballs or nurbs) on the  from the 's CPU data. As it is part of another thread, this time is not part of the usual frame time.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
SOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

A Operator Family that reads, creates and modifies 3D points, polygons, lines, particles, surfaces, spheres and meatballs. Particles and point clouds are now done primarily on the GPU using TOPs.



The sub-Family of Component types that are used to define and render 3D scenes. A Geometry Component is an Object that contains the 3D shapes to render. A Camera COMP and Light COMP are other Object types. Separately, "Objects" also refers to Python objects.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Polyreduce_SOP&oldid=24266"
		Category: SOPs

parameters.description: reduce - The polygons which will be candidates for simplification. Other polygons which share points with these might also be affected.

parameters.name: Features
parameters.label: Features
parameters.description: creases - Which polygons are feature edges.

parameters.name: Method
parameters.label: Method
parameters.description:
method -  - Select how to reduce the number of polygons from the following methods.

 percentage - Choose reduction level with a percentage. number - Choose reduction level by number of polygons. distance - Reduce polygons based on distance to an object.

parameters.name: Percentage
parameters.label: Percentage
parameters.description: percentage - Choose reduction level with a percentage. number - Choose reduction level by number of polygons. distance - Reduce polygons based on distance to an object.

parameters.name: Keep %
parameters.label: Keep %
parameters.description: percentage - Specify the percentage of polygons to keep when Method set to 'Percentage'.

parameters.name: Keep #
parameters.label: Keep #
parameters.description: numpolys - Specify the number of polygons to keep when Method set to 'Number'.

parameters.name: Object
parameters.label: Object
parameters.description: obj - The object to use as a reference.

parameters.name: Dist. Threshhold
parameters.label: Dist. Threshhold
parameters.description: distance - The world distance at which the polygons should be left at full detail.

parameters.name: Minimum %
parameters.label: Minimum %
parameters.description: minpercent - A lower bound to the level of reduction.

parameters.name: Stiffen Border
parameters.label: Stiffen Border
parameters.description: borderweight - Without any constraints, the edges of planar surfaces can erode. This controls a bias which penalizes such erosion.

parameters.name: Stiffen Features
parameters.label: Stiffen Features
parameters.description: creaseweight - The amount of penalty to add to the feature edges being eroded.

parameters.name: Equalize Edges
parameters.label: Equalize Edges
parameters.description: lengthweight - This bias penalizes the removal of long edges. It tends to reduce high aspect ratio triangles at the expense of more uniform reduction.

parameters.name: Prevent Mesh Inversion
parameters.label: Prevent Mesh Inversion
parameters.description: meshinvert - When enabled, each reduction is tested to see if it would flip a triangle normal. While encurring a slight cost, the results are almost always worth it.

parameters.name: Pre-Triangulate
parameters.label: Pre-Triangulate
parameters.description: triangulate - As only triangular polygons will be reduced, this option will automatically triangulate the input polygons.

parameters.name: Prevent Cracking
parameters.label: Prevent Cracking
parameters.description: keepedges - This prohibits the removal of any edge that occurs at the boundary of the polygons. This ensures no cracks develop with unreduced areas.

parameters.name: Use Original Points
parameters.label: Use Original Points
parameters.description: originalpoints - When it collapses edges, it will use one of the two original points instead of finding the optimal interior point.
